document_data.name: Silverale Hall
document_data.mainbody: '''Silverale Hall''' was a [[festhall]], inn, and tavern in [[Athkatla]], [[Amn]].
document_data.Location: It was situated in Athkatla's [[Athkatla/Center District|Center District]],{{Cite interactive atlas|3810 Athkatla}} a short 15-minute walk from [[Waukeen's Promenade]].
document_data.Structure: Silverale Hall was a four-story building built from stone. The festhall's signage was a silver mug overflowing with brew.
document_data.Services: The festhall was noted for its competent kitchen and the good humor of its patrons, as well as for being remarkably well-kept and clean. Although popular, it never felt crowded. The clientele mostly consisted of vendors from Waukeen's Promenade, caravaneers, and various other locals.
document_data.History: Said to be one of the oldest establishments of its kind in Athkatla,
document_data.Inhabitants:
* [[Hansil Ynnilross]], the proprietor; a [[half-elf|half-elven]] [[cleric]] of [[Milil]] and failed [[bard]].
* The [[Cyric]]ist priest [[Gildaar]] was known to occasionally frequent Silverale Hall.
* One of Silverale Hall's employees ''circa'' 1370 DR was fancied by [[Oryal Forestal]], spymaster of the Athkatlan chapter of the [[Shadow Thieves]], who valued both her good looks and the information she overheard.
